etymologies: late Middle English: from late Latin ligatio(n-), from the verb ligare (see ligate)

definitions: the surgical procedure of closing off a blood vessel or other duct or tube in the body by means of a ligature or clip

examples.text: the ligation of the cystic duct

shortDefinitions: surgical procedure of tying ligature tightly around blood vessel or other duct or tube in body

definitions: the joining of two DNA strands or other molecules by a phosphate ester linkage.
shortDefinitions: joining of two DNA strands or other molecules by phosphate ester linkage
